articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Tuesday received a message of greeting from Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria.
					The president in the message said that he and the Syrian people were celebrating the February 16, the 71st anniversary of the birth of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star), with Kim Jong Un and the friendly Korean people.
					
					He, availing himself of the opportunity, wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and prosperity.
					
					He sent the highest regards to him.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Democratic Congo
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, on Feb. 6.
					The president in his message said that he pays high tribute to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on the occasion of the 71st birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, Feb. 16 (the Day of the Shining Star), on behalf of his people and on his own behalf.
					
					The auspicious and historic holiday of the Korean nation is being celebrated by the people of Democratic Congo, he said. Availing himself of this opportunity, he hoped that the people and government of the DPRK would achieve great successes in accomplishing the just cause for defending the dignity of the nation and the sovereignty of the country, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					He sent best regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Mongolian People's Party
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Mongolian People's Party
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Feb. 5 received a congratulatory message from Enhtuvshin, chairman of the Mongolian People's Party.
					In his message the chairman extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					In the belief that the traditional cooperative relations between the two parties will grow stronger, the message wished Kim Jong Un greater success in his responsible work. 
					
					The chairman offered high regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Iranian President Meets DPRK Ambassador
articles.content:
Iranian President Meets DPRK Ambassador
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Iranian president said he hopes everything will go well in the DPRK under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people.
					When meeting DPRK Ambassador to Iran Jo In Chol on February 9, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad congratulated the DPRK on its latest achievements and stressed the Iranian people will always stand by the Korean people.

articles.title: Greetings to Beninese FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Beninese FM
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greeting to Nassirou Arifari Bako, minister of Foreign Affairs, African Integration, Francophone Countries and Overseas Compatriots, on Feb. 4 on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Benin. 
					The message recalled that the two countries have steadily developed the  friendly and cooperative relations in the efforts to carry out the common cause of building an independent, peaceful and prosperous new world since the establishment of the diplomatic ties. 
					
					It expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will grow stronger thanks to their common efforts.

articles.title: Floral Baskets, Congratulatory Letters to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Embassies, International Organizations
articles.content:
Floral Baskets, Congratulatory Letters to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Embassies, Missions of International Organizations
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received floral baskets and congratulatory letters from foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					Floral baskets and congratulatory letters from the Cambodian embassy, the Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK and the director of the Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya, a congratulatory letter and a gift from the charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy and congratulatory letters from the UNDP and UNICEF missions here were respectively handed over to officials concerned
					
					He also received a congratulatory letter from the Nigerian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The floral basket and congratulatory letter were handed to DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun by Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai on Thursday upon authorization by the corps.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, family of Ya. T. Nobichenko, an internationalist soldier, and Jong Il Sim, Korean in Russia, sent floral baskets to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star).
					They were laid before the statues on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il by Foreign Guests
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il by Foreign Guests
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests laid floral baskets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Thursday and paid tribute to them on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					Among them were the members of the missions of the UNDP and UNICEF and the economic and commercial councilors corps here and the participants of the 22nd Paektusan Prize International Figure-Skating Festival.

articles.title: Military Attaches Support Struggle of DPRK Service Personnel and People
articles.content:
Military Attaches Support Struggle of DPRK Service Personnel and People
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here Wednesday visited the post of the Korean People's Army (KPA) on Mt. Taedok where President Kim Il Sung put forth a slogan "A-Match-For-A-Hundred". The military attaches were greatly excited to make the visit.
					Hassan Reza Husseini, military attache of the Iranian embassy, wrote in a visitor's book that he got to know well about the essence of the slogan "A-Match-For-A-Hundred". He hoped that the army and people of the DPRK would defeat the enemies and achieve national reunification under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, upholding the banner of the Juche idea and Songun idea.
					
					Juan Miguel Garcia Montano, military attache of the Cuban embassy, said:
					
					The service personnel of the KPA are fully ready politically and ideologically and in military technique.
					
					Today the army and people of the DPRK are strikingly demonstrating their dignity in the struggle for protecting the country's sovereignty.
					
					He said he deeply felt the will of the service personnel to remain faithful to the idea and commandership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					Saying Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il always paid deep attention to the living conditions of the KPA service personnel, the military attache of the Vietnamese embassy noted he got deep impressions from the soldiers of the post full of revolutionary mettle and optimism.

articles.title: IIJI Director-General Here
articles.content:
IIJI Director-General Here
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI) who doubles as secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council, arrived here Thursday to take part in celebrations of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of KPA General
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of KPA General
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bier of General of the Korean People's Army Kwon Sang Ho, who was a lecturer at the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, on Thursday, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Citations Awarded to Officials and Members of Youth League and KCU
articles.content:
Citations Awarded to Officials and Members of Youth League and KCU
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Citations were awarded to exemplary organizations and members of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and members of the Korean Children's Union with due ceremony here on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize was awarded to 23 primary youth league committees and 65 officials and members of youth league. They built youth league organizations into the ranks of Songun young vanguard, performed feats in defending the country and building a thriving socialist nation and set an example in study and organizational life.
					
					Kim Jong Il Children Honor Prize went to 215 members of the children's union who set an example in study and organizational, socio-political activities and the do-good-thing campaign.

articles.title: Our Classroom Literature Prize Awarded to Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Our Classroom Literature Prize Awarded to Schoolchildren
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Our Classroom Literature Prize was conferred on schoolchildren in the DPRK.
					It went to more than 400 schoolchildren across the country including Kim Kum Sok of Maejon Secondary School in Phyongwon County, Pak Mi Ye of Pyongyang Munsu Secondary School, Jang Myong Rin of Paeksa Secondary School in Sinuiju City, Kim Jong Sim of Hoechang Secondary School in Hoechang County and Ri Chol Ju of Sinhyang Primary School in Chongjin City.
					
					They created a lot of works including children's song "We sing of the blessing of the sun", children's poem "Story about love conveyed as a legend" and words of song "We always miss you Marshal." They reflect the pledge of the people and schoolchildren across the country to hold in high esteem and follow the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Highly appreciated by members of the jury were children's poem "Certificate of delegate of Korean Children's Union", words of song "Precious souvenir picture", notes "Eternal cheers" and other works telling such loving care shown by Kim Jong Un for ordinary KCU members as inviting them to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the KCU.
					
					Among the works are those on the subject of study, organizational life and do-good-thing campaign and those representing the schoolchildren's wishes to guard the posts of national defence and volunteer to work at construction sites for building an economic giant.
					
					An awarding ceremony took place at the hall of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Thursday.

articles.title: 17th Kimjongilia Festival Opens
articles.content:
17th Kimjongilia Festival Opens
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The 17th Kimjongilia Festival was opened with due ceremony here on Thursday to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Displayed in the venue were immortal flowers cultivated by many units including armed forces and power organs, ministries and national institutions, service persons, people of all social standings and school youth and children.
					
					Those flowers were displayed by the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and overseas compatriots, diplomatic missions and missions of international organizations here, friendship and solidarity organizations of foreign countries, foreigners and Chinese residents in Korea.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop and others, delegations of overseas compatriots and foreign guests.
					
					Kim Chang Do, chairman of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee, in his opening address said that Kimjongilia is blooming more beautifully thanks to the reverence of the Korean people and other progressive people for Kim Jong Il growing stronger as the days go by.
					
					At the end of the opening ceremony its participants looked round the venue of the festival which presents fascinating scenery with immortal flowers.

articles.title: National Art Exhibition Opens to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
National Art Exhibition Opens to Mark Day of Shining Star
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A national art exhibition for marking the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) opened with due ceremony at the Korean Art Gallery Thursday.
					On show are 70 pieces of Korean paintings, oil paintings, acryl paintings and posters helping the visitors recollect the revolutionary history and personality of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					Korean painting "February Holiday before Korea's Liberation" and oil painting "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung and Anti-Japanese War Hero Kim Jong Suk Sightsee the Sunrise over Korea on Jong Il Peak " depicted exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu who gave a birth to the shining star of Mt. Paektu, thereby making the Korean people be blessed with illustrious leaders and commanders generation after generation.
					
					Acryl painting "Victory of the Korean Revolution Depends on the Arms in Our Hands" and oil painting "Inheritance of Songun Revolution" left deep impressions on the audience as they portrayed personalities of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as great men.
					
					Oil painting "Mansu Hill Overcrowded with Torrent of Yearning" truthfully portrayed the ardent yearning for Kim Jong Il and the firm will of all service personnel and people to uphold the dear respected Kim Jong Un, great sun of Songun, for all ages.

articles.title: GFTUK Members Meet to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
GFTUK Members Meet to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) Thursday held a meeting at the Central Hall of Workers  on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star). 
					Choe Su Dong, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the GFTUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Il's was the revolutionary life of a great revolutionary who explored an untrodden path with his iron will and superhuman energy under the uplifted red flag of the revolution and a peerless patriot who devoted his all to the country and its people.
					
					He unfolded a new chapter of accomplishing the cause of immortalizing President Kim Il Sung and made sure that his revolutionary life and feats are glorified forever with the prosperity of Juche Korea, they noted, adding:
					
					Kim Jong Il's idea and cause are successfully being carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					Under his wise leadership, there took place such great event as the entry of the DPRK's satellite into orbit, a demonstration of the national power of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea, and eye-opening successes were made in the building of a thriving nation.
					
					The successful third underground nuclear test, in particular, was a historic event that demonstrated the might of socialist military power led by another Songun brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu.
					
					Thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, Kim Jong Il's revolutionary life and immortal feats will shine long and his desire for building a thriving country become a brilliant reality.
					
					On the same day, a performance was given by the workers' art group of the Central Committee of the GFTUK for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Revolutionary Life of Kim Jong Il Remembered by Members, Officials of DWUK
articles.content:
Revolutionary Life of Kim Jong Il Remembered by Members, Officials of DWUK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A meeting  of  members and officials of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) took place at the Women's Hall on Thursday to remember leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birth anniversary. It was themed "General and women."
					The meeting began with narration and chorus "February Is Spring". The performers remembered with deep emotion the revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il, who was born as lodestar over Mt. Paektu and dedicated himself to the country and its people till the last moments of his life.
					
					Kim Yong Ok, manageress of the Kwangbok Area Supermarket, looked back upon the noble personality of Kim Jong Il who visited the supermarket on Dec. 15, 2011, providing important guidelines to be held fast to in the commercial service.
					
					Members of the DWUK art group in Pothonggang District told the story that Kim Jong Il personally watched their performance and showed such great care as inviting them to take part in the annual contest among art groups of military families of the Korean People's Army.
					
					Ri Chun Hui said in an excited tone that thanks to the loving care shown by Kim Jong Il, her daughter could have the honor and happiness of being a queen of marathon.
					
					Put on the stage were songs "Yearning Is Boundless", "It Is Thanks to Songun Politics Pursued by the General" and "Maxim of Our General." 
					
					Kim Thuk Sil, worker of Chilgol Restaurant, recounted the story that she has taken the lead in helping the army while Jo Sin Ok, room chief of the Pyongyang Floriculture Institute, vowed to bring about innovations in researches into flowers.
					
					Present there were Ri Yong Su, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jin Ha, secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, DWUK officials, members in the city, those who had the honor of being received by Kim Jong Il and those related to his revolutionary activities.

articles.title: Documentary Film Dealing with Kim Jong Il's Personality and Feats Shown
articles.content:
Documentary Film Dealing with Kim Jong Il's Personality and Feats Shown
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Korean documentary film "Our General Is Father of Families across the Country" was shown at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					The film deals with the devoted service of Kim Jong Il. Born into a log cabin in the forest of Mt. Paektu, he made long forced marches  for on-site guidance to meet people all his life and protected and exalted the destiny of the great family of socialism, it says.
					
					It also tells stories that he made sure that ordinary families were projected as patriotic families and admirable families in the era of Songun known to the whole country and its people and wished all children rosy future.
					
					It deals with the fact that thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un, another popular leader who personified the noble intention of the peerlessly great men, the great family of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea will last forever and no force on earth can overpower the might of the harmonious whole.
					
					Among the audience were senior officials of the party and state including Kim Yong Nam and Choe Yong Rim, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of power bodies, the Cabinet, social organizations, ministries and national institutions.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Thursday to pay tribute to them. Among them were the members of the delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China headed by Vice-Chairman Choe Su Bong, the delegation of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. headed by Secretary General Kim Hyon Hwan.
					They laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test Inspires Workers to Boost Production
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test Inspires Workers to Boost Production
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The successful 3rd nuclear test conducted by the DPRK has inspired its people to effect a production upsurge for building a thriving nation.
					According to an official concerned, the Pyongyang Wheat Flour Processing Factory overfulfilled its daily quota on February 12 and 13 at 150 percent, encouraged by the news of the test.
					
					Most of the workshops at the factory, including the confectionary workshop, ensure their operation at full capacity, topping increased targets on a daily basis.
					
					Ryo Song Hui, head of a work team, told KCNA:
					
					"I felt a thrill of joy when hearing the news about the successful 3rd underground nuclear test. It dealt a telling blow to the U.S. crying for sanctions and pressure against the DPRK over its peaceful satellite launch."
					
					A worker, Kim Yun Hui, said:
					
					"The news has greatly encouraged me and my fellow workers.
					
					Now we are in high spirits to hit the daily quota at 200 percent."

articles.title: Jagang Provincial People Joyful at Successful Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Jagang Provincial People Joyful at Successful Nuclear Test
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The successful 3rd underground nuclear test, conducted by the DPRK a few days ago, gave a great pleasure to all the people throughout the country, including those in Jagang Province.
					Hwang Chon Ryong, an employee at the Manpho Municipal People's Hospital, told KCNA:
					
					"The nuclear test is a substantial countermeasure taken in defence of the nation's sovereignty and security.
					
					The U.S. and its followers should correctly understand the fixed will of the DPRK that never makes empty words.
					
					The DPRK is not affected by any kind of sanctions and pressure."
					
					Un Sol Hwa, a student of Kanggye University of Education No. 2, said:
					
					"The test, an event of great significance in the history of the Korean nation, demonstrated the DPRK's mettle and courage.
					
					It is foolish of the U.S. and the UN Security Council to try to bring to its knees the DPRK that has taken to the road of independence, the road of Songun (military-first) politics.
					
					This event inspires us with courage to repulse any aggression forces."
					
					Sim Hyon, a worker at the Kanggye Condiment Factory, said:
					
					"It is high time we finally settled accounts with the U.S.
					
					Our country with tremendous military strength will surely emerge victorious in the showdown with the U.S. imperialists and their followers."

articles.title: Young People's Performance Marks Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Young People's Performance Marks Day of Shining Star
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A performance "The General Is the Banner of Victory" was given by the art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League at the Central Youth Hall on Thursday to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					Put on the stage were colorful numbers like female quintet "Frost Flowers" and male solo "The General Is the Son of the Guerrillas".
					
					The performers sang in praise of the revolutionary life and exploits of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, who fully demonstrated the dignity and might of Kim Il Sung's Korea by guiding the Korean revolution along the ever-victorious way with his extraordinary ideological and theoretical activities and energetic leadership.
					
					The repertoire included numbers singing of pride and honor of young people who are working miracles and innovations in the building of a thriving nation by their devoted efforts for patriotism.
					
					Mixed sextet "Our Leader Loved by the People" and female solo "Ardent Wishes" clearly showed the boundless reverence of the Korean people for the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, who provides ceaseless field guidance for the country's prosperity and the people's happiness.

articles.title: Servicepersons and People Here Meet to Hail Successful Underground Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Servicepersons and People Meet to Hail Successful Underground Nuclear Test
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang army-people rally took place at Kim Il Sung Square on Thursday to hail the successful 3rd underground nuclear test. 
					Present at the rally were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior officials of the party, state and army, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials of institutions at various levels, working people, teachers and students here. 
					
					Present there on invitation were delegations of overseas Koreans and other compatriots, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, diplomatic envoys of various countries and members of the military attaches corps here and other foreign guests. 
					
					The floor was taken by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on behalf of the WPK, General Yun Tong Hyon on behalf of the service personnel the KPA, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, on behalf of youth and students, Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, on behalf of the working class, Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, on behalf of agricultural workers, and Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, on behalf of the intellectuals to congratulate the successful 3rd underground nuclear test.
					
					The speakers warmly hailed the successful nuclear test which resolutely frustrated the brigandish campaign of "sanctions" launched by the U.S. in wanton violation of the DPRK's right to satellite launch for peaceful purposes and significantly decorated the February jubilee with another great victory of Songun Korea.
					
					The nuclear test was a decisive and just step for self-defence to cope with the hostile policy of the U.S. with much fuss about "harsher sanctions" and "preemptive strike" over the satellite launch of the DPRK, they noted, and continued:
					
					It serves as a striking demonstration of the might of a scientific and technological power and a military power capable of manufacturing any strike means if it is determined to do. 
					
					They extended warm congratulations to the heroic scientists, technicians, workers and officials on their great success in the nuclear test at a high level. 
					
					The successful nuclear test is the brilliant fruition of the extraordinary decision and matchless gut of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, peerless statesman and brilliant Songun commander of Mt. Paektu, who put the dignity and stamina of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea on the highest level, the speakers added.
					
					It is the DPRK's mode and mettle of counter-action and confrontation to settle accounts with the barbaric hostile forces with a barrage of fire. If the U.S. continues going reckless, the DPRK will deal unpredictable merciless retaliatory blows at the U.S.
					
					The speakers stressed that the service personnel and people of the DPRK would glorify this year marking its 65th founding anniversary and the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War as great festival of victors and triumphantly build on this land the most powerful country in the world.

articles.title: DPRK People Call for Tougher Counteractions
articles.content:
DPRK People Call for Tougher Counteractions
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK people, including servicepersons, have unanimously hailed the successful underground nuclear test, which was conducted in the country on Tuesday.
					They also want to see that the country takes the second and third high-intensity counteractions in succession if the U.S. persists in its hostile policy toward it.
					
					Ri Song Ho, an officer of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA:
					
					"Through the recent test, the U.S. and its followers should be well aware of the steadfast will of the Korean army and people to defend the nation's sovereignty at all costs.
					
					Impudently, they are now calling for vessel inspections and maritime blockade against the DPRK.
					
					We, servicepersons, who value the nation's sovereignty dearer than their lives, will not tolerate any slightest provocation but deal a merciless retaliatory strike to the provokers. The DPRK boasts of its inexhaustible military might."
					
					Rim In Guk, a researcher of Hamhung University of Agriculture, said:
					
					"The successful nuclear test gave courage and confidence in victory to the people in full readiness to turn out in an all-out action against the U.S. and its followers.
					
					As long as we have strong nuclear deterrent, we are afraid of nothing.
					
					I think it is necessary for the DPRK to go on with taking toughest counteractions until the U.S. chooses to respect the DPRK's right to satellite launch and repent of its high-handed practices.
					
					Concession leads to defeat in the face-off. Key to ultimate victory is to steadily increase the military capability in every way."

articles.title: Anti-epidemic Activities Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Anti-epidemic Activities Brisk in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has paid deep attention to preventing respiratory epidemic.
					In this regard, KCNA met Pak Myong Su, director of the State Sanitary Inspection Board under the Ministry of Public Health.
					
					He said:
					
					"The Board has directed big efforts to making medical checkup and providing hygienic information on a regular basis to prevent influenza especially among infants and schoolchildren in winter season.
					
					The hygienic and anti-epidemic work is instrumental to implementing the prophylactic policy of the Workers' Party of Korea. The Board intensified information and publicity activities by means of art squads and display of visual aids focused on symptoms and therapy of influenza and on how to prevent it.
					
					It also established a nationwide medical checkup system for prevention of respiratory epidemic."
					
					Meanwhile, the DPRK finished Pentavalent vaccination among the children throughout the country.

articles.title: Korea's Traditional Sporting Events
articles.content:
Korea's Traditional Sporting Events
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Korean people have long maintained their traditional sporting events, which are mainly categorized by physical training, intelligence development and martial arts.
					Physical training events include seesawing, running race, tug of war and wrestling while intelligence development events are characterized by paduk (go) and chess.
					
					Martial arts events include Subak (Korean martial arts using only hands), spearing, Taekwon-Do and archery.
					
					Koreans spared no efforts in training martial arts, particularly in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668), to defend the territory from invasion. Practicing archery and horse riding were considered a sacred deed and duty.
					
					The traditional sporting events are still encouraged in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

articles.title: Illegal UNSC's "Resolution" Does Not Work on DPRK: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Illegal UNSC's "Resolution" Does Not Work on DPRK: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's nuclear test is a just physical counteraction against the U.S., which prodded the UN Security Council into adopting "resolution on sanctions" 2087 against the DPRK, thereby denying its legitimate right and seriously insulting the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK. 
					Such "resolution" characterized by double standards and shameless nature can never frighten the army and people of the DPRK all out in the drive for accomplishing the just cause. 
					
					Those countries that stockpiled more nukes than any others in the world fabricated UNSC's "resolutions" 1718 and 1874 which call for denying the DPRK's right to satellite launch, terming its nuclear tests conducted for self-defence to cope with the U.S. nuclear threat actions "a threat to the international peace". 
					
					The DPRK has never recognized the "resolutions on sanctions" against it, but strongly rejected them as they are products of the U.S. hostile policy towards it.
					
					However, the U.S. deliberately cooked up again the unjust "resolution on sanctions" 2087 which denies the right to satellite launch for peaceful purposes, legitimate right of a sovereign state, in disregard of the universally accepted international law. 
					
					The DPRK's test of a high-performance A-bomb is the most reasonable option to defend its independence and dignity as a sovereign state, defuse the more than half a century-old  U.S. nuclear threat and achieve peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					The U.S. has introduced nukes into south Korea since the 1950s, resorting to a nuclear blackmail against the DPRK strongly opposed to the U.S. moves for aggression.
					
					Accustomed to approaching everything of the DPRK from its standpoint of confrontation, the U.S. has stood in the way of the DPRK's use of nuclear energy and space development for building an economic power, describing it as a "threat".
					
					It is the scenario of the U.S. to make the 21st century "a new U.S. century" by stifling the DPRK keeping to the road of independence, Songun and socialism and eventually putting the Asia-Pacific region under its control.
					
					"Resolution" 2087 cooked up by the U.S. and its allies is nothing but a product of its vicious hostile policy towards the DPRK and a fraudulent document devoid of any legality.
					
					If the U.S. is allowed to deprive a sovereign state of its right to space development for peaceful purposes, there is no need to discuss justice and truth in the international relations and the world is bound to turn into a theater under the sway of the jungle law.
					
					The gangster-like U.S. should be countered only by force.
					
					The all-out action against the U.S. declared by the DPRK is a just and sacred historic cause of putting an end to the long-standing U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and its arbitrary practices and defend the sovereignty and security of the country and the nation and achieve its peace and prosperity.
					
					If the U.S. persistently sticks to such policy despite the DPRK's repeated warnings, it will never be able to escape stronger retaliation of Songun Korea.

articles.title: Japan, Island Country, Will Stand Politically Isolated: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Japan, Island Country, Will Stand Politically Isolated: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Japan is increasingly turning to the right and militaristic. New Prime Minister Abe is taking the lead in it.
					On February 2, he openly hinted the possibility of reexamining the 1995 Murayama's statement which expressed apology and remorse for the Japanese imperialists' past colonial rule.
					
					On February 7, he disclosed his intention to reexamine the 1993 Kono's statement which admitted the coercive nature of the sexual slavery system for the Imperial Japanese Army. He, referring to the visit to the Yasukuni Shrine, said that he regards it as very regretful that he failed to pay visit to the shrine during the first Abe cabinet period.
					
					Abe made the election commitments to rename the Japan "Self-Defence Forces" the "national defence forces" and reorganize them and revise the pacifist constitution to secure the exercise of the right to collective self-defense. He is spurring the preparations for putting them into force.
					
					Meanwhile, the ultra-right forces of Japan have been keen on making the visit to the shrine an official and regular event by building up the public opinion for the visit.
					
					This made Japan to lurch more to the right and militaristic. Japan's reinvasion of Asia is not just anticipated but is becoming a reality.
					
					Abe declared the start of the new year's work of the new government by singing "Kimigayo" on the morning of January 7. He then openly said that "this is the first step for retaking Japan".
					
					The people of Korea and other Asian countries can not view it as a normal happening nor remain an onlooker to the development in Japan.
					
					Japan, which Abe vowed to take back, is clearly indicated in Kimigayo sang by him.
					
					He meant an aggression state that has turned to the right and militaristic, not just a normal and usual state of the international community as often claimed by Japan. This is exactly the re-emergence of imperialist Japan and the revival of militarist Japan which made Korea and other Asian countries to be drenched with blood shed by the people.
					
					For decades after the war, Japan has systematically pushed forward the plan to rearm the country politically and militarily in an over-all manner. Lately Abe, top figure of ultra-right forces, took power, clarifying the path to be taken by Japan obsessed with militarist fever. 
					
					The situation proves that the foreign policy of the present Japanese government is aimed to revive the colonial domination system that existed before Japan's defeat, not to promote good-neighborly and friendly relations with its neighboring countries, and that it moves to plunge Korea and other Asian countries in the sea of blood of aggression and oppression once again.
					
					But Japan is mistaken.
					
					Though it clamored for becoming the "leader of East Asia", it gained the disgraceful defeat and an ill fame of an enemy state through its wars of aggression against Korea and other Asian countries.
					
					Japan is still isolated and rejected by the international community, especially by Asian countries as it has denied and evaded repentance, apology and reparation for its past crimes.
					
					Japan's past crimes are denounced even in the political circle of the U.S., its master, and assertions calling for inflicting harsher punishment on it are heard from there. This proves the political and moral vulgarity of Japan that has reached the height.
					
					The childish country, Japan is increasingly turning to the right, unhindered, while desperately denying its past history of crimes. Japan's militarist foreign policy will naturally spark off bigger censure and political isolation from the international community including Asia.
					
					Gloomier is the prospect of the island country, Japan, which is isolated even politically as well as geographically.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Just Counteraction to Cope with Enemies' Nuclear Threat: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Just Counteraction to Cope with Enemies' Nuclear Threat: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's third underground nuclear test is a decisive step for self-defense to cope with the high-handed hostile actions of the U.S. and its allies, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined article. 
					The article goes on:
					
					Some time ago, the U.S. and other hostile forces recklessly fabricated unprecedented UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK, groundlessly taking issue with its legitimate satellite launch for peaceful purposes. 
					
					These days the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea together with the U.S. is escalating its military provocations against the DPRK in wanton violation of its independent right, talking about "additional provocation" and "warning." This reminds one of a guilty party filing the suit first.
					
					The prevailing situation indicates that warmongers in south Korea and abroad are making desperate efforts to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK, taking advantage of its satellite launch and just step for defending its sovereignty as a golden chance for invading it. 
					
					The DPRK's third nuclear test was conducted as part of its practical counteraction for defending the security and sovereignty of the country in order to show the anger of all the servicepersons and people of the DPRK and their will to punish the U.S. and its allies and protect the sovereignty and security of the country from their reckless moves for a war against it.
					
					The U.S. and south Korean puppet authorities persistently resort to the brigandish "sanctions" campaign and the moves for a nuclear war to isolate and stifle the dignified DPRK at any cost. It is self-evident that it is necessary to settle accounts with them with arms, not with words. 
					
					If the U.S. and its allies aggravate the situation while making much fuss about UNSC's "additional sanctions" and "stronger reaction," this would be as foolish an act as precipitating its self-destruction. 
					
					It is the steadfast resolution of the DPRK to take the second and third stronger steps in succession to deal with such provocative moves of the hostile forces as "inspection of ships", "sea blockade" and "financial sanctions".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hails Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hails Nuclear Test
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK fully demonstrated its tremendous potential and military capability of the great Paektusan nation through its 3rd underground nuclear test, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an editorial.
					It continues:
					
					The peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and the sovereignty and the right of the nation to existence are guaranteed by the DPRK's potential capability strong enough to foil any moves of the enemies for aggression.
					
					The DPRK succeeded in conducting a safe and perfect nuclear test at a higher level than that in the past, clearly showing how high its level of science and technology is and how tremendous its economic potential and defence industry are.
					
					It is a shining victory of the Songun revolution that the DPRK is capable of producing anything more powerful than a nuke by its own efforts and with its indigenous technology as it pleases despite the imperialists' persistent sanctions and moves to stifle it.
					
					The military and technological superiority is no longer a monopoly of the imperialists. Gone are the days never to return when the enemies could threaten the DPRK with A-bombs.
					
					Even when the U.S. imperialists launch another campaign for pressure and aggression against the DPRK over its nuclear test, it will never work on it because it is fully prepared for both sanctions and war.
					
					For the DPRK, the integral whole of the leader, party, army and people is a weapon more powerful than a nuke.
					
					As it has the single-minded unity plus nuclear deterrence, the DPRK is not afraid of any formidable enemy and there is no powerful enemy it cannot beat.
					
					The DPRK will be ever-victorious in the future, too as it proudly emerged a satellite manufacturer and launcher and nuclear weapons state with all service personnel and people united closer around the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns of Toughest Counteraction against Violation of Sovereignty
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns of Toughest Counteraction against Violation of Sovereignty
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK succeeded in the third underground nuclear test. Through this its service personnel and people declared at home and abroad their steadfast stand that it never yields to any sanctions, blockade, military threat and pressure of the imperialists and their followers but firmly defends the dignity, sovereignty and security of the country and nation through strong counteractions.
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined article.
					
					The DPRK staged the underground nuclear test to cope with the anti-DPRK hostile acts of the U.S. imperialists who prodded the UN Security Council into cooking up the brigandish "resolution on sanctions" against it over its launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					They threatened the DPRK to take "a crucial measure" against it if it launches a satellite or conducts a nuclear test and even issued such ultimatum as browbeating it to impose stronger "financial sanctions" unless it implements the "resolution." The army and people of the DPRK can never remain a passive onlooker to their pressure.
					
					The DPRK's nuclear test is a just measure for self-defence to cope with the intensified U.S. nuclear blackmail against it.
					
					The underground nuclear test was conducted by the DPRK against the backdrop of demonstration of huge military muscle by the imperialist allied forces and their followers, gruesome war atmosphere created by them and their mobilization of dangerous means for blocking the economic development of the DPRK and dishonest elements' gambles threatening its vital rights.
					
					It is the disposition and firm will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to counter a high-handed policy with toughest policy and react to "sanctions" and pressure with an all-out counter-action.
					
					If the U.S. and its allies challenge the DPRK with "strong measure", "financial freeze" and fresh pressure and "sanctions" over its underground nuclear test, it will react to them with stronger measures for self-defence.
					
					The DPRK does not read other's face nor makes any empty talk. It will take toughest measures against the U.S. and other hostile forces' violation of sovereignty and react to their blockade and "sanctions" with a merciless punishment and constant countermeasures.
					
					The U.S. imperialists had better stop acting rashly.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime's Suppression of Pro-Reunification Patriots Slammed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime's Suppression of Pro-Reunification Patriots Slammed
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China denounced the south Korean puppet regime for its crackdown upon pro-reunification patriotic people.
					In a statement on Tuesday, the spokesman denounced a south Korean court for sentencing to heavy penalties the vice-chairman and the secretary general of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification. The statement called the judgment an intolerable challenge against the Korean nation's desire for reunification.
					
					It urged the puppet regime to abrogate the notorious "Security Law" at once and release all the pro-reunification patriotic people.
					
					It voiced expectation that south Korean organizations and people of different social standings will terminate the fascist tyranny and turn out in a dynamic nation-wide action to wipe out the anti-reunification forces.
					
					All the members of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China will wage a dynamic action to implement the north-south joint declarations, it noted.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Hit for Passing Unjust Judgment on Pro-Reunification Patriots
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Hit for Passing Unjust Judgment on Pro-Reunification Patriots
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Joint Secretariat of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) on Feb. 9 issued a statement titled "We strongly denounce traitorous and anti-reunification judgment going against national reconciliation and unity".
					The statement recalled that on Feb. 8 the south Korean Seoul Central District Court sentenced Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon, to four years in prison and four years of suspension of qualification and its Secretary General Won Jin Uk to three years in prison and three years of suspension of qualification by invoking the ill-famed "Security Law".
					
					The SL, the worst law in the world, is an unethical one against human rights which is aimed to violate and restrain the freedom of thinking, conscience, assembly and demonstration, it noted.
					
					Ro's consolatory visit was promoted by the will to express his deep condolences over the greatest loss to the fellow countrymen as a member of the same nation, share the sorrow with those in the north and open the way of the national reconciliation, unity and reunification, it said, and went on:
					
					His visit was very just in view of ethics and morality and beautiful manners and customs of the Korean people that had been handed down through generations as well as in the light of national reconciliation and unity.
					
					Passing prison terms on Won who should receive medical treatment in stable conditions as a cancer patient is an unjust judgment as it denied even the elementary human rights.
					
					It stressed that Pomminryon will wage a joint action to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, have the SL abolished and set free the prisoners of conscience defying the fascist suppression by the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Concert Given by Chinese Residents in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Concert Given by Chinese Residents in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A concert was given by Chinese residents in Pyongyang at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Present there were officials of the C.C., the Federation of Chinese Residents in Korea, Chinese residents here and officials concerned.
					
					The concert began with immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Jong Il" in chorus. Put on the stage were female chorus "Our Leader Loved by the People", male solo "Tell, Road of Songun", mixed chorus "Yearning Is Boundless", chorus "Footsteps" and female chorus "The People Have Single Mind".
					
					The singers sang of the reverence for Kim Jong Il who made the forced march of high intensity till the last moments of his life.

articles.title: News of DPRK's Success in Third Underground Nuclear Test Reported Abroad
articles.content:
News of DPRK's Success in Third Underground Nuclear Test Reported Abroad
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign media on Tuesday reported the news that the DPRK successfully conducted the third underground nuclear test.
					The DPRK conducted the third underground nuclear test to cope with the U.S. hostile moves against it, ITAR-TASS said, adding:
					
					The Korean Central News Agency noted in its report that the nuclear test was conducted in a safe and perfect way on a high level with the use of a smaller and light A-bomb unlike the previous ones, yet with great explosive power and it was confirmed that the test didn't give any adverse effect to the surrounding ecological environment.
					
					The nuclear test will serve as an important occasion for guaranteeing peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula and the region.
					
					Prensa Latina of Cuba, ABC radio of Australia, BBC, AP, VOA, Kyodo News, Jiji Press, Mainichi Shimbun, Tokyo Shimbun and NHK reported the same news.

articles.title: News of Meeting of Political Bureau of C.C. of WPK Reported in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
News of Meeting of Political Bureau of C.C. of WPK Reported in Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign media Tuesday reported about the decision "On marking the 65th anniversary of the DPRK and the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War as grand festivals of victors" adopted at the meeting of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					The decision stressed the need to resolutely foil all the hostile forces' moves to stifle the DPRK with proud victory in building an economic power and improving the people living standard, ITAR-TASS noted, adding:
					
					The decision called for staging an all-out action of high intensity to reliably safeguard the security and sovereignty of the country, coping with the prevailing grave situation. It also underlined the need to continue launching satellites and powerful long-range rockets.
					
					It stressed that once an order is issued, the Korean People's Army should blow up the strongholds of aggression at a stroke and wipe out the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet army to the last man and thus accomplish the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					Underlining the need to give further spurs to building a highly civilized socialist nation, it referred to the tasks for establishing a medical information service network and telemedicine system, building a children's hospital, a dental hospital, a recovery center and more modern cultural facilities.
					
					AP, CNN, The Washington Post, The New York Times, Kyodo News and Tokyo Shimbun reported the same news.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed in Russia
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Russia to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					A Kimjongilia show and an opening ceremony of a Korean photo, book and fine arts exhibition took place in Sovietskaya Gaban District of Khabarovsk Territory and Nakhodka City, Maritime Territory on January 30 and February 5.
					
					On display in their venues were photos of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un on their revolutionary activities.
					
					Also displayed there were over 100 potted Kimjongilias in full bloom, works of the peerlessly great men and other Korean books and fine arts pieces associated with the resourcefulness and skills of Koreans.
					
					The deputy governor of the district administration said that photos, books and fine arts pieces on display help Russians know well about the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					The mayor of Nakhodka expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries for whose development Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul all his life would grow stronger under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					The secretary of the Nakhodka Branch of the United Russia Party noted that there are many countries and nations in the world but it is only the DPRK that has remained true to its principle of independence in the international arena and it is only the Korean leaders, great famous men, who glorified their lives with ardent love for the country and the nation.
					
					The vice-mayor of Partizansk City said that the reverence for Generalissimo Kim Jong Il is growing deeper among the Korean and world people as the days go by, adding that he is always alive in the hearts of the world progressive people.
					
					An art performance was given in Nakhodka City by staff members of the DPRK consulate general there and students of the conservatory in the city.
					
					Korean and Russian songs were put on the stage.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed by Indonesian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed by Indonesian Papers
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Indonesian newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					International Media on February 8 devoted its one whole page to articles under various titles illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					The paper said in an article titled "Great exploits leader Kim Jong Il performed by devoting himself to the cause of socialism" that the greatest exploit Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, performed on behalf of the cause of socialism was that he protected the destiny of socialism.
					
					The article said that the world socialist movement has dynamically advanced along the new orbit since the historic Pyongyang Declaration was adopted under his energetic leadership.
					
					It noted that the immortal exploits he performed for the victory of the cause of socialism has been successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					It stressed that Kim Jong Il, who made a great contribution to the global cause of socialism, is always alive in the hearts of progressive mankind.
					
					The paper said in an article titled "Korea does what it is determined to do" the launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 in December last year created a great stir in the international community. Everybody should bear in mind that the DPRK never says empty words, it added.
					
					Suara Karya on February 7 said in an article titled "Man believing in people as in Heaven" that Kim Jong Il devoted his all to the improvement of the people's living standard, regarding believing in the people as in Heaven as his maxim.

articles.title: Lectures Given Abroad to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Lectures Given Abroad to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Lectures took place in Tajikistan, Serbia, Guinea and Spain in the period between January 31 and February 6 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					Kurbonzyon Mirzoyeva, member of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, said that Kim Jong Il developed the Workers' Party of Korea into an invincible, tested and experienced party which achieved its perfect unity and cohesion on the basis of the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The precious exploits he performed on behalf of the Korean and world revolution would always be remembered by progressive mankind, she added.
					
					The general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party praised him as an outstanding thinker and theoretician, great statesman, peerlessly Songun brilliant commander and benevolent father of the people as he performed immortal exploits in the sacred cause for the country and its people.
					
					Although he passed away, his exploits performed on behalf of the Korean revolution and history would always shine, the general secretary noted.
					
					Secouna Camara, director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, said that Kim Jong Il was a great man possessed of rare enthusiasm, adding that his strong sense of responsibility for the country and its people was the source of his extraordinary fervor with which he valued time more than any others and made the best use of it.
					
					A message of greeting to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the lecture in Guinea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Peruvian Organization
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was posted on the website of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on February 6.
					The work, published on January 29, Juche 92 (2003), clarifies the idea that the Songun-based revolutionary line, the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea, is an effective political mode in the present era in which President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of giving importance to the army have been carried forward and developed. The work also clarifies the idea that it is a scientific and revolutionary line and political mode most correctly meeting the requirements of the times and the revolution.
					
					The website said in a preface that Generalissimo Kim Jong Il defended socialism with the Songun revolutionary leadership for over a half century and developed and enriched the revolutionary idea of Kim Il Sung.
					
					The revolutionary history of Kim Jong Il is, in a word, a history of Songun shining with victory and glory, it stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by British Organization
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Articles under various titles were posted on the website of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on February 4 and 5 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The website said in an article titled "Exploits leader Kim Jong Il performed for the cause of socialism" that he performed immortal exploits in carrying out the cause of socialism.
					
					It referred to the fact that he proved scientific accuracy and truth of socialism and the inevitability of its victory through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.
					
					Recalling that he firmly defended the dignity and sovereignty of the country and nation by resolutely meeting the challenges of the imperialists with his unique Songun politics, it stressed that he is always alive in the hearts of humankind.
					
					The website said in an article titled "On the road of dedication to the people" his life was totally dedicated to the people.
					
					He was the great leader of the people who found his joy in providing field guidance for them, it noted.
					
					The Korean people will hold him in high esteem forever as he devoted all his life to them, it concluded.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Works Held in Peru, Romania
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Works Held in Peru, Romania
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Seminars on leader Kim Jong Il's works took place in Peru and Romania on February 5 and 7 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					A reporter and speakers including the chairman of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, addressing a seminar on Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party," paid high tribute to him who frustrated the moves of the imperialist allied forces, firmly defended the banner of socialism and provided a sure guarantee for realizing the cause of independence.
					
					They referred to the fact that he clarified in his work the validity and vitality of the cause of socialism and the inevitability of its victory.
					
					They stressed that his work serves as a banner instilling faith and courage into the progressive humankind aspiring after socialism.
					
					They noted that he frustrated the moves of the imperialists to bring down socialism and stifle the DPRK and led the building of a thriving socialist nation to a victory with his unique Songun politics.
					
					Speakers including the chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania at a seminar on his work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" praised him for clearly indicating the way for humankind to follow by steadily developing and enriching the Juche idea through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Mexico
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was carried by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in its bulletin on February 5.
					The work, made public on April 6, Juche 101(2012), clarifies that it is a principled requirement for victoriously advancing the cause of the Korean revolution to eternally hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					It also indicates the tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Korean Films Screened in Peru, Guinea, Romania
articles.content:
Korean Films Screened in Peru, Guinea, Romania
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Film shows took place in Peru, Guinea and Romania on Feb. 5 and 6 to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					Films shown included Korean film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					Victor Oliva Miguel, general secretary of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru, said Kim Jong Il wisely led the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of global independence with his Songun politics and made great achievements.
					
					Lately the U.S. and forces kowtowing to it are doing all sorts of vicious acts, touting "sanctions" against the DPRK over its satellite launch. Victor Oliva Miguel, said, and went on: However, the Korean people continue to make strenuous efforts to defend the country's sovereignty and socialism without any slightest vacillation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					Eleazar Ramos Roarte, chairperson of the Peruvian Committee for Remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, Guillermo Alcazar Ribera, chairperson of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Roberto Carbonel Pezo, chairman of the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for Study of the Juche Based Songun Policy, and Yuri Castro Romero, secretary general of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Cultural and Friendship, lauded the Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il, saying his life, indeed, represented a history of Songun.
					
					Camano Vitor, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry of Guinea, said Kim Jong Il performed undying exploits for the country and people, the era and history by wisely leading the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people for a long time.
					
					Solid foundations for building a thriving socialist nation were laid in the DPRK thanks to him, the chairman added.

articles.title: DPRK's Stand for Defending Sovereignty Supported by Syrian, Peruvian Political Parties
articles.content:
DPRK's Stand for Defending Sovereignty Supported by Syrian, Peruvian Political Parties
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Political parties in Syria and Peru issued statements on February 3 and 5 in condemnation of the UN Security Council's "resolution" against the DPRK.
					The Communist Party of Syria (Unity) in a statement expressed concerns over the fact that the U.S. has put pressure on the DPRK for decades, imposing political, economic and military blockades upon it. The statement extended solidarity to the resolute struggle of the Korean people against the moves of the U.S.
					
					It actively supported the DPRK's rights to scientific and technological development and space exploration and its stance for defending its sovereignty by meeting all sorts of challenges from the imperialists and foiling all their aggression moves.
					
					The Socialist Party of Peru in a statement stressed the DPRK's satellite launch was an exercise of its legitimate right as a member nation of the UN and a member of the international community.
					
					The UNSC adopted the anti-DPRK "resolution" under the pressure of the U.S. and its followers who groundlessly termed the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes a "long-range missile launch", the statement noted, adding:
					
					This shows that the UNSC is being abused by the imperialists who resort to high-handed and arbitrary practices, away from its basic mission of respecting the sovereignty of the UN member nations and ensuring world peace and security.
					
					The Socialist Party of Peru denounces the UNSC's "resolution on sanctions" as it violates the independent and legitimate right of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones de embajadas y organizaciones internacionales
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones de embajadas y organizaciones internacionales
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibiolos cestos de flores y cartas de felicitacion que le dedicaran el dia 14 las embajadas de varios paises y las representaciones de las organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea con motivo del dia del natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					Fueron entregados por separado a los funcionarios correspondientes de la RPDC el cesto de flores y la carta de felicitacion de la embajada de Camboya, el embajador vietnamita y  el director de la Oficina de Cooperacion Economica de Libia, la carta de felicitacion y presente del encargado de negocios a.i. de la Republica Arabe de Siria, las cartas de felicitacion de las representaciones del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo y del Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia y la carta de felicitacion del embajador nigeriano.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente sirio
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 12 el Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					La misiva sigue:
					
					Yo y el pueblo arabe de Siria conmemoramos junto con Vd. y el amistoso pueblo coreano el Dia de la Estrella Luz, 16 de febrero en que se cumple el 71o aniversario de natalicio de Su Excelencia Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad, deseo buena salud y felicidad a Vd. y mayor progreso y prosperidad al amistoso pueblo coreano.
					
					Reciba el testimonio de mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones de Cuerpo Diplomatico en Corea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones de Cuerpo Diplomatico en Corea
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores y carta de felicitacion que le dedicara el Cuerpo Diplomatico acreditado en Corea con motivo del dia del natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					Por encargo del citado cuerpo, el embajador chino Liu Hongcai los traslado este jueves al canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun.

articles.title: Gremiales de UMDC recuerdan vida revolucionaria de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gremiales de UMDC recuerdan vida revolucionaria de Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tuvo lugar este jueves en la Casa de la Mujer la escena de recordacion de las miembros y funcionarias de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea (UMDC) "El General y las mujeres".
					En la escena iniciada con la narracion y coro "Febrero es primavera" las ejecutantes recordaron con gran emocion la vida revolucionaria del General Kim Jong Il quien nacio como estrella luz del monte Paektu y vivio hasta el ultimo momento de su vida por la patria y el pueblo. 
					
					La gerente del Supermercado del Area de Kwangbok, Kim Yong Ok, recordo las nobles cualidades del Dirigente quien visito su puesto de trabajo el 15 de diciembre de 2011 y le dio instrucciones programaticas a ser mantenidas en el servicio comercial.
					
					Las miembros del grupo artistico de la UMDC en el municipio de Pothonggang dijeron que el Dirigente vio la funcion de ellas y les permitio participar en el concurso de grupos artisticos de esposas de oficiales que tiene lugar anualmente.
					
					Ri Chun Hui dijo con emocion que en el regazo del General, su hija se hizo campeona de maraton. 
					
					Las ejecutantes interpretaron en la ocasion las canciones como "No tiene fin la anoranza", "Lema de nuestro General", etc.
					
					La obrera del restaurante de Chilgol, Kim Thuk Sil, conto como ella pudo ser ejemplar en la asistencia al ejercito mientras la jefa de seccion del Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang, Jo Sin Ok, manifesto la decision de registrar innovaciones en la investigacion de flores. 
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Yong Su, el secretario del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Kim Jin Ha, las funcionarias de la UMDC y las miembros de la misma entidad en esta capital, las mujeres recibidas por el Dirigente y las relacionadas con el.

articles.title: Inaugurado el XVII Festival de Kimjongilias
articles.content:
Inaugurado el XVII Festival de Kimjongilias
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurado el jueves en esta capital el XVII Festival de Kimjongilias en homenaje al dia del natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					En la sede estan exhibidas las kimjongilias cultivadas por los organismos de las fuerzas armadas y el poder, los ministerios, los organos centrales y otras muchas unidades, los militares del EPC, los trabajadores de distintos estratos y los jovenes y ninos escolares. 
					
					Se ven tambien las ejemplares presentadas por el Presidium del Comite Central de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon, los compatriotas en ultramar, las representaciones diplomaticas de varios paises y las representaciones de organizaciones internacionales, acreditadas en Corea, las entidades de amistad y solidaridad en el extranjero, las personalidades extranjeras y los chinos residentes en Corea.
					
					En la ceremonia de apertura participaron Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop y otros cuadros, las delegaciones de coreanos residentes en ultramar y los huespedes extranjeros. 
					
					El presidente del Comite Coreano de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia, Kim Chang Do, dijo en su discurso inaugural que la kimjongilia, flor inmortal, se torna cada dia mas hermosa gracias al creciente deseo del pueblo coreano y la humanidad progresista de elogiar al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Terminado el acto, los participantes pasaron revista a las flores exhibidas.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion central de bellas artes por Dia de Estrella Luz
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion central de bellas artes por Dia de Estrella Luz
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la exposicion central de bellas artes dedicada al dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en una ceremonia que tuvo lugar el dia 14 en el Museo de Bellas Artes de Corea.
					En la sede de galeria estan exhibidas mas de 70 obras de bellas artes, incluyendo la pintura al estilo coreano, la al oleo, la acrilica y la pancarta que muestran las historias revolucionarias y rasgos de los 3 generales del monte Paektu.
					
					La pintura al estilo coreano "Fiesta de febrero en visperas de la liberacion de la patria" y la acrilica "El Presidente Kim Il Sung y la heroina de lucha antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk viendo la salida del sol en Corea desde el pico Jong Il" elogian las hazanas de los grandes Hombres del monte Paektu quienes dieron a luz el Lucero del monte Paektu haciendo al pueblo coreano tener de generacion en generacion la fortuna de contar con excelentes lideres y generales.
					
					La acrilica "En el fusil que empunamos hay la victoria de la revolucion coreana" y la pintura al oleo "Patrimonio de la revolucion del Songun" describieron magnificamente la grandeza de los Generalisimos dejando profunda impresion a los visitantes.
					
					La pintura al oleo "Reina el sentimiento de anoranza en la colina Mansu" demuestra la anoranza al Dirigente y la firme voluntad de todo el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea de enaltecerlo eternamente como sol del Songun.

articles.title: ACNC rechaza "resolucion de sancion" del Consejo de Seguridad de ONU
articles.content:
ACNC rechaza "resolucion de sancion" del Consejo de Seguridad de ONU
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- La prueba nuclear es la justa contramedida fisica frente a las hostilidades de Estados Unidos que nego el legitimo derecho de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y ofendio seriamente su soberania y dignidad al fabricar la "resolucion de sancion" no. 2087 instigando al Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					Con esa "resolucion", caracterizada por la pauta de doble rasero y el cinismo, no se puede asustar al ejercito y pueblo coreanos levantados en su justa causa.
					
					Calificando como "amenazantes a la paz mundial" las anteriores pruebas nucleares de la RPDC ejecutadas frente a la amenaza nuclear del imperio, los paises, que poseen el mayor numero de armas nucleares, aprobaron las "resoluciones" no. 1718 y no. 1874 del CS de la ONU que niegan hasta el derecho al lanzamiento de satelite artificial.
					
					La RPDC no ha reconocido nunca esas "resoluciones", productos de la politica hostil del imperio, y viene rechazandolas tajantemente.
					
					No obstante, EE.UU. fabrico otra "resolucion de sancion" no. 2087 que niega el legitimo derecho de Estado soberano a lanzar satelites con fines pacificos desestimando las universales leyes internacionales.
					
					La prueba nuclear, realizada ayer por la RPDC con la bomba atomica de alto poder, constituye la opcion mas racional para defender la soberania y la dignidad de Estado soberano, disuadir la amenaza nuclear del imperio que perdura mas de medio siglo en la Peninsula Coreana y lograr la paz y estabilidad.   
					
					Para aplastar a la RPDC que hace frente rotundo a las maniobras agresivas, EE.UU. introdujo desde la decada de 1950 en el territorio surcoreano sus armas nucleares y chantajeo a la primera durante mas de medio siglo.
					
					EE.UU., acostumbrado a tratar con la concepcion conflictiva todos los asuntos relacionados con la RPDC, impide el uso de energia nuclear y el desarrollo de cosmos de ella para la construccion de potencia economica calificandolos como "factores de amenaza".
					
					Persigue unicamente la ambicion de atropellar a Corea que avanza por el camino de la independencia, el Songun y el socialismo y de convertir el siglo 21 en "la nueva era de EE.UU." al tomar la region de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					La "resolucion" no. 2087, que han fabricado EE.UU. y sus satelites, es el fruto de la politica hostil a la RPDC y documento fraudulento e ilegitimo.
